Also for the first time, Microsoft says it is making the cloud-based edition of the software available before the on-premise, server-based version, which will come out in late February. That really reflects the push Microsoft is making into the cloud, Steve Ballmer said during an online launch event on Thursday. Microsoft's not the only one gunning for the cloud. DC- In a surprise shakeup, Google co-founder Larry Page is replacing Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the search giant. Starting April 4, Page will take over day-to-day operations while Eric Schmidt becomes executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership. Shortly after the announcement was posted on the company's blog, Eric Schmidt tweeted "Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed!" in reference to his much-discussed role as a moderating check to Page
